business.headline: Is stock market open today? What investors should know on Budget 2026 dayThe National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) are both conducting full trading sessions today. This marks only the second time since Independence that equity markets are open on a Sunday.

Share market live: Sensex gains 200 points, Nifty over 25,300 ahead of BudgetStock Market on Budget Day 2026: A rare Sunday trading session is being held to coincide with budget day, with investors tracking policy announcements and early reactions in real time as the Sensex and Nifty navigate heightened volatility and cautious sentiment.

Budget 2026 likely to spotlight big reforms, but is any tax relief on the cards?Budget 2026 may lean more toward long-term reforms than quick relief, which raises the question of whether meaningful tax relief will feature in Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's speech. Here is all you need to know.

Live: Nirmala Sitharaman in Parliament, to present record 9th Budget shortlyBudget 2026 Speech Live Updates: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is all set to present her record ninth Budget. This is the first time in independent India's history that the Budget is being presented on a Sunday. The fiscal 2027 Budget comes against the backdrop of geopolitical uncertainties, with US President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs prominently featuring as a contributor. It is expected to focus on cross-sector reforms, aimed at simplifying regulations, bettering competitiveness, and strengthening domestic manufacturing. As part of tradition, Sitharaman met President Droupadi Murmu earlier in the day, after which the latter fed her the customary dahi-cheeni (curd mixed with sugar) for goodluck. The Finance Minister will begin her Budget address in Parliament at 11 am. Stay tuned at Indiatoday.in for live updates.

Nirmala Sitharaman to present Budget 2026 today, focus on Part B reformsFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's ninth Union Budget signals a shift in approach, using Part B to lay out India's broader economic vision and the government's reform roadmap.

Big tax changes unlikely in Budget 2026. So what can you expect?With major tax relief already delivered last year and the economy stable, Budget 2026 is expected to offer only minor tweaks. The chances of a big income tax announcement remain slim.

EU deal a defining moment, India negotiates from position of strength: Piyush GoyalUnion Minister Piyush Goyal says India negotiated the EU free trade agreement from a position of strength, with the deal expected to open new markets and create millions of jobs in key sectors.

Why there's no buzz ahead of Budget 2026With tax reforms already delivered, inflation under control and the economy stable, Budget 2026 is expected to emphasise stability and long-term growth, which is why public expectations remain modest this year.

NSE, BSE to hold rare Sunday trading session for Budget 2026The National Stock Exchange and the Bombay Stock Exchange will conduct a full trading session, making this only the second instance since Independence that equity markets will operate on a Sunday.

Why Nike is relaunching its India online store with NykaaThe partnership has already sparked curiosity among Indian consumers and the retail industry, raising questions about why a global sportswear giant is handing a key piece of its digital business to an Indian online fashion retail platform.

Is AI boom really behind the sudden drop in global tech stocks?As high-priced software firms face tighter competition and slowing growth, is the recent plunge in global tech stocks truly an AI shock or just a correction catching up with fundamentals?

India's focus should be on education to compete with US and China: Jayant SinhaJayant Sinha said competing with the United States and China will require a budget that focuses on education, higher productivity and broader technological access.

How freebies bled Indian economy. Economic Survey suggests a Brazilian modelThe Economic Survey 2025-26 flags the unchecked rise of freebies provided by the state governments in India. It says they are draining public finances, widening deficits by leaving little money for investments in infrastructure and human capital. It argues that reforms are needed to the freebie culture, and urges policymakers to adopt outcome-linked, time-bound models like Brazil's Bolsa Familia.

Budget 2026: Trade deficit grew under UPA and NDA, pace slowed after 2014India's trade deficit widened under both UPA and NDA, but Economic Survey 2026 data shows the pace slowed after 2014 as import growth moderated, despite weaker export momentum.

ED arrests ex-Reliance Communication chief Punit Garg in Rs 40,000-crore fraud casePunit Garg served as President handling the company's Global Enterprise Business between 2006 and 2013, and later as President (Regulatory Affairs) from 2014 to 2017.

NSE IPO finally approved after 9 years: Here's all you need to knowWith Sebi's clearance in hand, NSE can now formally appoint merchant bankers and legal advisers to prepare its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP). Market estimates suggest the exchange could take around eight to nine months to launch the IPO.

Will Budget 2026 bring income tax relief? What salaried taxpayers can expectAhead of Budget 2026, one question dominates conversations among salaried taxpayers: will income tax relief finally come? Let's have a look.

From AI skilling to real jobs: What industry wants from Budget 2026India has no shortage of AI talent, but turning skills into sustainable jobs remains a challenge. Ahead of Budget 2026, industry leaders want policies that connect training, infrastructure and real-world deployment.
Sensex, Nifty pause winning rally as investors turn cautious ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 296.59 points lower at 82,269.78, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 98.25 points to end at 25,320.65.

8th Pay Commission: Will employees get arrears, and if yes, when?With January 2026 nearly over and no formal announcement yet, government employees are growing anxious about the 8th Pay Commission. The big question now is whether delayed salary revisions will lead to arrears, and when the money may actually reach their bank accounts.

entertainment.headline: Border 2 box office Day 9: Sunny's film set to rule 2026, crosses Rs 250 crore mark Sunny Deol's war film 'Border 2' surpassed Rs 250 crore at the box office within nine days of release. The film outperformed expectations and held steady against the debut of 'Mardaani 3'.

Mardaani 3 box office Day 2: Rani Mukerji's cop drama stays strong vs Border 2 Rani Mukerji's action thriller 'Mardaani 3' has achieved robust box office numbers in its first two days, holding its own despite competition from 'Border 2' and surpassing the opening collections of earlier films in the franchise.

Ram Charan and Upasana welcome twins, Chiranjeevi shares joyful update with fans Actor Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela have welcomed twins, a boy and a girl. Chiranjeevi Konidela shared the news on social media.

Copy, borrow, rehash: Why can't desi reality TV create a uniquely Indian show? Reality TV in India is all about franchised foreign shows being rehashed in Hindi or local languages. It's time our production houses tried creating truly Indian concepts.

Akshaye Khanna grooves to Chaiyya Chaiyya in old clip, fans can't keep calm Akshaye Khanna's old video grooving to Chaiyya Chaiyya has emerged online. Fans reacted to the video and expressed their love for the actor.

Kennedy: Anurag Kashyap's film set for OTT release after world premiere at Cannes The neo-noir thriller 'Kennedy' directed by Anurag Kashyap and starring Rahul Bhat and Sunny Leone, will premiere on ZEE5 on February 20, 2026. The film had its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in 2023.

Explained: How Dhurandhar led Flipperachi's FA9LA to a Guinness World Record Bahraini rapper Flipperachi's 2024 track 'FA9LA' secured a Guinness World Record following its inclusion in Aditya Dhar's 2025 film 'Dhurandhar'. This new honour has sparked international acclaim and renewed popularity despite the film's ban in Gulf nations.

Kichcha Sudeep marks 30 years in cinema, promises to work even harder Kannada star Kichcha Sudeep marked 30 years in the industry with a heartfelt message expressing thanks to fans, collaborators, and the Kannada film fraternity for their support and inspiration throughout his career.

I loved it: Akshay Kumar praises 'goddess of acting' Rani Mukerji in Mardaani 3 Akshay Kumar has voiced his support for Rani Mukerji and her latest film, 'Mardaani 3', through a social media post. His support comes as the film is experiencing increasing popularity at the box office across India.

Salman Khan on Battle of Galwan trolling: It's a Colonel's look, not a romantic one Salman Khan responded to the social media trolling over his look in Battle of Galwan teaser. The film is directed by Apoorva Lahia and also features Chitrangda Singh.

Kalpana Iyer reacts to viral Ramba Ho video, thanks Dhurandhar team for reviving it In an interview with India Today, veteran actor Kalpana Iyer spoke about her viral dance at a wedding. The actor expressed joy and gratitude about receiving so much love.

Valentine's special: Salman Khan's Tere Naam to re-release in theatres The 2003 romantic drama 'Tere Naam', starring Salman Khan, will return to theatres in India with a special re-release on February 27, 2026.

Border 2: Sunny Deol grooves, cuts cake amid film's roaring success. Watch Sunny Deol and the cast of Border 2* celebrate the film's success as it achieves record-breaking earnings just days after its Republic Day release.

Amaal Mallik backs AR Rahman's stance on industry bias but disagrees on communalism Amaal Mallik reacted to AR Rahman's comments about communal bias in the Hindi film industry. He emphasised that Rahman was trying to highlight a larger issue.

Home Alone star Macaulay Culkin mourns on-screen mother Catherine O'Hara Macaulay Culkin remembered his on-screen mother from Home Alone, the late actor Catherine O'Hara. Schidt's Creek co-creator Dan Levy also paid tribute to O'Hara.

Alia on online comments on marriage to Ranbir: The noise doesn't reach us Alia Bhatt dismissed the noise surrounding her relationship with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor. She opened up on how she and Ranbir deal with public scrutiny, memes and commentary about their marriage.

Ananya Panday-Lakshya lead Karan Johar's Chand Mera Dil. Check release date Karan Johar is backing a new film titled Chand Mera Dil, featuring Ananya Panday and Lakshya in lead roles. The film will be Ananya's second release after Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri.
Thanks, but no thanks, Sunny Deol: Border 2 has a serious problem My father served in the Army, so I will always have a soft corner for Border. Sadly, Border 2 disappointed me.

Homi Adajania wraps Cocktail 2 with Shahid, Kriti and Rashmika: Feels special Shahid Kapoor, Rashmika Mandanna and Kriti Sanon wrapped up the shooting of Cocktail 2. The actors celebrated with director Homi Adajania after the shoot concluded.

general news.headline: They are coming in: Trump claims India will buy Venezuelan oil, not Iran crudeThe United States is encouraging India to consider Venezuelan oil as a replacement for Russian imports, part of Washington's broader effort to limit funds flowing to Moscow amid its war in Ukraine.

1000s of AI bots gather at bot-only site, talk of their consciousnessMany people are currently using an AI system called Moltbot — actually renamed to OpenClaw. It lets people run almost autonomous AI. Now, these bots have discovered they can gather together on the web and talk about bot stuff privately. They are talking of stuff that will come across as a nightmare to humans.

Budget: Nirmala Sitharaman's quiet Tamil Nadu outreach with Kanjeevaram sareeBudget 2026: Over the years, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget-day sarees have evolved into a cultural statement, blending heritage and symbolism with political cues.

Waiter serves beef instead of mutton to Bengali actor at Kolkata pub, arrestedA waiter at a Park Street pub in Kolkata was arrested after actor and influencer Sayak Chakraborty alleged he was served beef instead of mutton, hurting his religious sentiments.

How Pakistan's Dilan Teer Bija became chief guest at Hyderabadi shaadisA Balochi song, Dilan Teer Bija, has been a must-play at shaadis in India's Hyderabad for years. Dilan Teer Bija was a political song of Benazir Bhutto's time from Karachi's Lyari, the canvas of Dhurandhar. But how did a PPP song become a staple in marriages in India? This Sunday Special reveals the unusual journey of music across borders.

Share market live: Sensex gains 200 points, Nifty over 25,300 ahead of BudgetStock Market on Budget Day 2026: A rare Sunday trading session is being held to coincide with budget day, with investors tracking policy announcements and early reactions in real time as the Sensex and Nifty navigate heightened volatility and cautious sentiment.

Why India-EU trade deal is mother of all setbacks for PakistanThe India-EU free trade agreement (FTA), years in the making, will give India broad market access to those sectors that have long fostered Pakistan's export success in Europe, especially textiles and apparel. Pakistan now seems to be feeling the heat and is in panic mode.

Explained: What is bahi-khata, the red ledger seen during the Union Budget?As Union Budget 2026 approaches, the red Budget file once again becomes a powerful visual symbol. From colonial briefcases to the Indian bahi-khata, the story reflects India's evolving fiscal identity.

Copy, borrow, rehash: Why can't desi reality TV create a uniquely Indian show?Handcrafted ByOur Editors Reality TV in India is all about franchised foreign shows being rehashed in Hindi or local languages. It's time our production houses tried creating truly Indian concepts.

80 killed as Baloch militants strike 12 locations across Pakistan's BalochistanAt least 70 militants and 10 security personnel were killed after coordinated attacks targeted security forces, police and civilians across 12 locations in Pakistan's Balochistan province, officials said on Saturday.

Ram Charan and Upasana welcome twins, Chiranjeevi shares joyful update with fansActor Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela have welcomed twins, a boy and a girl. Chiranjeevi Konidela shared the news on social media.

4 shots fired outside Rohit Shetty's Mumbai home, police begin probeAccording to people present at the scene, four rounds of gunfire were heard outside Shetty's house, after which police and security agencies acted swiftly. Senior officers from the city police, zonal units, and the crime branch reached the location soon after.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Melbourne Park braces for ultimate Difficult vs Impossible clashAustralian Open: Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic are all set for a blockbuster final at Melbourne Park on Sunday. While Djokovic is looking for his 25th Grand Slam title, Alcaraz is one win away from a Career Slam.

Trashy rumination: India dismisses PM Modi's Israel visit mention in Epstein filesIndia has responded to reports of an email message from the Epstein files that has a reference to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his visit to Israel.
Light rain in Delhi-NCR as AQI in national capital remains very poorSeveral parts of Delhi and the wider National Capital Region (NCR) witnessed light rain in the early hours of Sunday.

Played porn, turned up TV to mute cries: Teen raped by father for years exposes himA disturbing case from Gujarat reveals how a minor girl was sexually abused by her father after her mother was diagnosed with cancer.
Thanks, but no thanks, Sunny Deol: Border 2 has a serious problemMy father served in the Army, so I will always have a soft corner for Border. Sadly, Border 2 disappointed me.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Pakistan hands over 7 Indians who accidently crossed border during 2023 floodsSeven Indians detained in Pakistan after accidental border crossings during the 2023 floods were handed over to the BSF at Attari, ending months to years of custody across the border.

Watch: Chelsea vs West Ham thriller ends in ugly brawl as Todibo strangles Joao PedroChelsea completed a stunning 3–2 comeback against West Ham at Stamford Bridge, but victory was eclipsed by chaos. A stoppage-time brawl ended with Todibo sent off for throttling Joao Pedro, turning a thriller into flashpoint.

Kennedy: Anurag Kashyap's film set for OTT release after world premiere at CannesThe neo-noir thriller 'Kennedy' directed by Anurag Kashyap and starring Rahul Bhat and Sunny Leone, will premiere on ZEE5 on February 20, 2026. The film had its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in 2023.

140 lashes under Sharia law: Indonesian couple flogged for sex outside marriageThe punishment, carried out in Banda Aceh, was among the harshest imposed in recent years and drew renewed criticism from human rights groups over the continued use of public flogging in the province.

Who is Sunetra Pawar, Maharashtra's first woman Deputy CM?If her husband, Ajit Pawar, was Baramati's 'Dada', Sunetra was fondly called by the people simply as 'vahini' (sister-in-law in Marathi). As she makes history as the first woman Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, the soft-spoken Sunetra Pawar will have her task cut out.

Photos of ex-Prince Andrew crouching over woman in new Epstein filesFormer prince Andrew, the brother of the UK's King Charles, is seen kneeling over a woman lying on the floor in the photos released by the US Justice Department linked to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

sports.headline: Ishan Kishan grabs the Tatkal ticket. Is Sanju Samson back on the waiting list? Has one dominant T20I series reshaped India's batting hierarchy? Ishan Kishan's surge has brought urgency and clarity, while Sanju Samson's struggles have reopened familiar questions on the eve of a T20 World Cup title defence.

If Abhishek doesn't get you, Ishan will: NZ skipper Santner on India's Trivandrum show Ishan Kishan's Thiruvananthapuram hundred left New Zealand out of options, forcing Mitchell Santner to put his hands up. With the T20 World Cup days away, India's batting firepower is peaking at the right time.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Melbourne Park braces for ultimate Difficult vs Impossible clash Australian Open: Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic are all set for a blockbuster final at Melbourne Park on Sunday. While Djokovic is looking for his 25th Grand Slam title, Alcaraz is one win away from a Career Slam.

Watch: Chelsea vs West Ham thriller ends in ugly brawl as Todibo strangles Joao Pedro Chelsea completed a stunning 3–2 comeback against West Ham at Stamford Bridge, but victory was eclipsed by chaos. A stoppage-time brawl ended with Todibo sent off for throttling Joao Pedro, turning a thriller into flashpoint.

The Jemimah Rodrigues struggle: Why the Delhi captain is faltering in close matches WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues has endured a mixed season as captain, with Delhi Capitals on the brink of an early exit from the tournament. The challenges have been compounded by her struggles with the bat, making it a testing campaign both as a leader and as a batter.

Alcaraz vs Djokovic live streaming: When and where to watch Australian Open final Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz meet in the Australian Open men's singles final. The match could redefine tennis history with records and legacies on the line.

IND vs NZ: Why did Ishan Kishan keep in place of Samson? Suryakumar Yadav explains Ishan Kishan took over wicketkeeping duties and scored his maiden T20I hundred in the fifth match against New Zealand. This planned rotation strategy boosts India's preparation and confidence ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Kishan not satisfied with New Zealand comeback, sets sights on World Cup glory Ishan Kishan scored a stunning century in the final T20I against New Zealand in Thiruvananthapuram. He remains focused on winning the T20 World Cup in 2026 despite his comeback success.

IND vs PAK, U19 World Cup: India seek payback against Pakistan after Asia Cup rout India U19 prepare to face Pakistan in a crucial Super Six World Cup match. The game carries added tension following a heavy Asia Cup final defeat for India.

Ishan, Arshdeep power Trivandrum rout as India firm T20 World Cup favourites tag IND vs NZ, 5th T20I: Led by Ishan Kishan's brutal maiden century and a clinical maiden five-wicket haul from Arshdeep Singh, India dismantled New Zealand in Thiruvananthapuram. Despite a heavy evening dew, a record-breaking 271 proved insurmountable, as the Men in Blue emphatically reinforced their status as the side to beat at the upcoming T20 World Cup.

Usman Tariq's bowling under scanner? Cameron Green fumes after his dismissal: Watch Cameron Green questioned Usman Tariq's bowling action after his dismissal in the second T20I between Pakistan and Australia. Pakistan dominated the match to seal a 2-0 series lead amid growing debate over the spinner's legality.
South Africa vs West Indies 3rd T20I: Live score and updates from JohannesburgSouth Africa vs West Indies, 3rd T20I Live Score: South Africa have won the toss and chose to bowl first.

WPL 2026 Qualification Scenario: How MI, DC and UP Warriorz can qualify for EliminatorWPL 2026: Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, and UP Warriorz are still in the race for the Eliminator, with only one league match remaining on February 1 between the Capitals and the Warriorz.

In Sanju Samson's hometown, Ishan Kishan makes statement with 42-ball hundredIND vs NZ: Ishan Kishan scored his spectacular maiden T20I century against New Zealand during the fifth T20I in Thiruvananthapuram. He smashed six fours and ten sixes in his innings to help India post 271/5 in their 20 overs.

Fiery Suryakumar Yadav sends T20 World Cup warning with historic T20I recordIND vs N: Suryakumar Yadav became the fastest batter to reach 3,000 runs in men's T20Is, achieving the feat in the fifth and final T20I against New Zealand in Trivandrum.

Sanju Samson's horror run continues, batter disappoints local crowd in TrivandrumIND vs NZ: Sanju Samson failed to impress at his home ground during the fifth T20I against New Zealand. The opening batter was dismissed for 6, leaving his large fanbase disappointed.

International Olympic Committee monitors India after T20 World Cup row: ReportThe 2026 T20 World Cup disco has put India's 2036 Olympic hosting ambitions under scrutiny, with the IOC unlikely to tolerate political tensions that risk boycotts by participating nations.

Kishan, Patel return for 5th T20I as India finalise World Cup preparationIndia made three changes to their playing XI for the final T20I against New Zealand. Captain Suryakumar Yadav opted to bat first to test bowlers under dew ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Subtle over spectacle: Rybakina's calm celebration strikes a chord after winAustralian Open: Elena Rybakina marked her maiden Australian Open title at Melbourne Park with a restrained celebration, offering only a quiet fist pump. On Saturday, she defeated Aryna Sabalenka in three sets to avenge her loss in the 2023 final.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Who is Rafael Nadal supporting in AUS Open final?Australian Open: Legendary Rafael Nadal will be happy if Novak Djokovic wins the Australian Open. Speaking ahead of the 2026 final, Nadal has explained what impresses him the most about Djokovic.

Giant-sized cut-out, fan from Qatar: Trivandrum turns up for Sanju SamsonIndia vs New Zealand: A festival-like mood engulfed Thiruvananthapuram as a Rs 1.2 lakh giant cut-out, drummers and devoted fans, including one from Qatar, celebrated Sanju Samson's long-awaited homecoming.

Elena Rybakina gets sweet revenge over Aryna Sabalenka, lifts Australian Open crownAustralian Open 2026: Elena Rybakina won her maiden title at Melbourne Park after beating World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling three-setter on Saturday at the Rod Laver Arena. Sabalenka, meanwhile, lost back-to-back finals at Melbourne Park.

5th T20I Highlights: Arshdeep's 5-wicket haul sets up 46-run win for IndiaIndia vs New Zealand, 5th T20I Highlights: India beat New Zealand by 46 runs in the final T20I in Thiruvananthapuram to complete a 4-1 series win. Arshdeep Singh starred with his maiden five-wicket haul, while Axar Patel also scalped three wickets. Finn Allen was the lone warrior for New Zealand with his brilliant innings of 80 (38).

Tilak Varma's last bid push for T20 World Cup, trains intensely with Mayank YadavTilak Varma has been training hard to be fully fit for the T20 World Cup after he missed the five-match T20I series against New Zealand. Tilak last played for India in the South Africa T20Is after which he played two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches.

India need to stick with Gautam Gambhir, split coaching confuses players: BavumaSplit coaching is not going to solve India's ongoing Test crisis, feels South Africa's Temba Bavuma. Bavuma believes that removing Gambhir from the Test job and giving it to someone else is not going to help the Indian team.

Premier League: Managerial fates on line as Spurs face City, Liverpool host NewcastleSuper Sunday turns the Premier League spotlight on managers, with pressure mounting as results shape narratives and futures. Tottenham's City test and Liverpool's Newcastle clash could redefine Thomas Frank and Arne Slot's seasons this weekend.

T20 World Cup: Pat Cummins ruled out, no Steve Smith in Australia's squadT20 World Cup: Australia have suffered a major setback going into the T20 World Cup captain. Senior fast bowler Pat Cummins has been ruled out of the tournament due to a back injury.

Women's Singles Final Highlights: Comeback queen Rybakina wins Australian OpenAustralian Open 2026 Highlights, Women's Singles final: Elena Rybakina has pulled off an incredible comeback win against Aryna Sabalenka. 0-3 down in the decider, Rybakina beats Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 to clinch her maiden Australian Open title.

Harry Brook makes U-turn on England nightclub row: Admits lying to protect teammatesHarry Brook admitted he lied about the Wellington nightclub incident to protect teammates. The U-turn comes amid wider scrutiny of England's off-field conduct following a bruising Ashes tour and disciplinary investigations.

An unbeaten juggernaut, invincible India stand ready to defend T20 World CupT20 cricket thrives on unpredictability, yet India have dominated the format since August 2023. The defending champions have won 49 of their 63 matches, losing just three, and remain unbeaten across bilateral series and multi-nation events. No team has won the men's T20 World Cup at home or defended the title, but this Indian side has the form and balance to challenge history.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
